==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ご|だん|かつ|よう|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
A compound of {{m|ja|sc=Jpan|五段|tr=godan||five grades}} and {{m|ja|sc=Jpan|活用|tr=katsuyō||conjugation}}. An extension of the [[四段活用]] (yodan katsuyō) conjugation class, the fifth base, -o, is a pseudo base derived from the suffix -o attaching to the [[未然形|irrealis]] conjugation resulting in -au, which phonologically regularly elides into [oː].
